predicate.note: Frames file for 'conclude' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. Comparison with 'decide' and 'end'.

example.name: icky
example.text: An undistinguished college student who dabbled in zoology until he concluded that he couldn't stand cutting up frogs, Mr. Corry wanted to work for a big company ``that could do big things.''
example.arg: he couldn't stand cutting up frogs

example.name: only transitive
example.text: Mr. Nichol said he was ``extremely disappointed in the continuing deterioration of the company's operations while it attempted *trace* to conclude the reorganization during the past four months.''

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John concluded his after-dinner speech with a belch.
